titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to ensure that electrochromic glass qualifies as energy property for purposes of the energy credit.
Electrochromic Glass Act of 2016
Electrochromic Glass Act of 2016

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary:
Electrochromic Glass Act of 2016
This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to specify that the use of electrochromic glass qualifies for the tax credit for investment in energy property. (Electrochromic glass is able to switch from clear to dark using a switch, sensor, timer, or similar controls.)
